meanings.definition: Pollinators: organisms that transfer pollen from one flower to another
meanings.sent1: Bees are important pollinators in the garden.
meanings.sent2: Butterflies and birds are also pollinators that help flowers grow.
meanings.sent3: The pollinators had a busy day flying from bloom to bloom.
meanings.sent4: The tiny pollinators are like nature's messengers, carrying life from one plant to another.
meanings.sent5: Without pollinators, many plants would not be able to reproduce.

meanings.definition: Pollinators: animals that assist in the fertilization of plants by transferring pollen
meanings.sent1: Hummingbirds are colorful pollinators that visit flowers for nectar.
meanings.sent2: Some beetles are also pollinators, unknowingly helping plants reproduce.
meanings.sent3: The pollinators threw a party in the garden, spreading pollen everywhere.
meanings.sent4: Watching the pollinators at work is like witnessing a magical dance of nature.
meanings.sent5: Farmers rely on pollinators to ensure their crops produce fruits and seeds.
